anl.verdi.core

Class VerdiApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • anl.verdi.core.VerdiApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatasetModelListener, FormulaElementCreator, PlotListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.ListDataListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener

    public class VerdiApplication
extends java.lang.Object
implements PlotListener, DatasetModelListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, FormulaElementCreator, javax.swing.event.ListDataListener
    Main verdi application facade.
    Version:
    $Revision$ $Date$
    Author:
    Nick Collier

      • evaluateFormula

        public DataFrame evaluateFormula(Formula.Type type)
        Evaluates the current formula and returns the result. If there is no current formula then returns null. Then will evaluate the formula against the date range calculated by resolving the various date constraints and trying to find the largest legal overlapping segment.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of formula (e.g. Tile, TimeSeries etc.) to evaluate
        Returns:
        the result of the evaluation or null if the evaluation fails.

      • evaluateFormula

        public DataFrame evaluateFormula(Formula.Type type,
                        DateRange dateRange)
        Evaluates the current formula and returns the result. If there is no current formula then returns null. The evaluation will ignore the the date range calculated by resolving the various date constraints and trying to find the largest legal overlapping segment and use the passed-in parameter instead.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of formula (e.g. Tile, TimeSeries etc.) to evaluate
        dateRange - the dateRange to evaluate the formula against
        Returns:
        the result of the evaluation or null if the evaluation fails

      • evaluateFormula

        public DataFrame evaluateFormula(java.lang.String strFormula,
                        Formula.Type type,
                        DateRange dateRange)
        Evaluates the current formula and returns the result. If there is no current formula then returns null. The evaluation will ignore the the date range calculated by resolving the various date constraints and trying to find the largest legal overlapping segment and use the passed in parameter instead.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of formula (e.g. Tile, TimeSeries etc.) to evaluate
        dateRange - the dateRange to evaluate the formula against
        Returns:
        the result of the evaluation or null if the evaluation fails.
